Its research areas encompass High Performance Computing (HPC), Grid and Cloud Computing, Multilingual and Heritage Computing, VLSI and Processor Design, Embedded Systems, Speech and Natural Language Processing, Information and Cyber Security, Ubiquitous Computing, Bioinformatics, Geomatics, Digital Forensics, Big Data Analytics, Blockchain, Health Informatics, and Quantum Computing. C-DAC's notable products include the PARAM series of supercomputers, VEGA Microprocessors based on RISC-V architecture, M-Kavach 2 mobile security solution, Bharat Operating System Solutions (BOSS), and eSanjeevani telemedicine platform. The organization also offers advanced computing diploma programs through its Advanced Computing Training School (ACTS) and has established Centres of Excellence in Information Technology (CEIT) abroad under the Ministry of External Affairs' development partnership projects.

name: Hindustan Organic Chemicals Limited
description: Hindustan Organic Chemicals Limited (HOCL) is a central public sector undertaking established in 1960 under the Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers, Government of India. Headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, with a major manufacturing unit in Ambalamugal, Kochi, Kerala, HOCL was founded to achieve self-reliance in the production of basic organic chemicals and reduce dependence on imports. The company specializes in the manufacture of chemicals such as phenol, acetone, nitrobenzene, aniline, nitrotoluenes, chlorobenzenes, and nitrochlorobenzenes. These chemicals serve as key inputs for industries including pharmaceuticals, pesticides, dyes, plastics, and rubber. HOCL is recognized as the second-largest producer of phenol and acetone in India. Additionally, through its subsidiary, Hindustan Fluorocarbons Limited (HFL), HOCL produces polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE), a versatile engineering plastic. The company is listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE: 500449) and is majority-owned by the Government of India.

name: Footwear Design and Development Institute
description: The Footwear Design and Development Institute (FDDI) is a premier academic and training institution established in 1986 under the aegis of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Government of India. Headquartered in Noida, Uttar Pradesh, FDDI was designated as an 'Institution of National Importance' under the FDDI Act, 2017. The institute specializes in the fields of footwear design, leather goods, fashion design, and retail management. FDDI offers comprehensive undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including Bachelor of Design (B.Des) and Master of Design (M.Des) degrees, across its 12 state-of-the-art campuses located in Noida, Fursatganj (Raebareli), Chennai, Kolkata, Rohtak, Chhindwara, Guna, Jodhpur, Ankleshwar, Banur, Patna, and Hyderabad. The institute conducts the All India Selection Test (AIST) annually for admissions. FDDI is renowned for its industry-oriented curriculum, modern infrastructure, and strong placement records, contributing significantly to the growth of the footwear, fashion, and retail sectors in India.

name: Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research
description: The Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (JIPMER) is a premier public medical institution located in Puducherry, India. Established in 1823 as the cole de Mdecine de Pondichry by the French government, it was later taken over by the Government of India and renamed in honor of India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru. In 2008, JIPMER was designated as an Institute of National Importance (INI) under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The institute offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and super-specialty medical courses, including MBBS, MD, MS, DM, and MCh programs. Admissions are based on national-level entrance examinations such as NEET-UG, INI-CET, and INI-SS. JIPMER is also renowned for its research contributions in modern medicine, public health, and medical education, with collaborations with international institutions like the Harvard School of Public Health. The campus spans 195 acres and includes multiple hospital blocks, a nursing college, and research facilities. In the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2024, JIPMER was ranked 5th among medical institutions in India.

name: Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers Limited
description: Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers Limited (RCFL) is a leading public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers, Government of India. Established in 1978, RCF is headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, and operates two manufacturing units located at Trombay (Mumbai) and Thal (Raigad district, Maharashtra). The company specializes in the production of a wide range of fertilizers and industrial chemicals, including urea, complex fertilizers (NPK), bio-fertilizers, micro-nutrients, and various industrial chemicals such as methanol, nitric acid, and ammonium nitrate. RCF's products are widely used in agriculture and various industries like pharmaceuticals, dyes, and leather. The company has been accorded 'Navratna' status and is known for its commitment to sustainability, with initiatives like operating sewage treatment plants to meet its water requirements.

name: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited
description: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MMRCL) is a joint venture between the Government of India and the Government of Maharashtra, established to implement the Mumbai Metro Line-3 (Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ), also known as the Aqua Line. This 33.5 km fully underground corridor aims to alleviate traffic congestion in Mumbai by providing a modern, efficient, and sustainable mass rapid transit system. The line comprises 27 stations and is designed to connect key business districts, educational institutions, and the international airport, thereby enhancing urban mobility. MMRCL employs advanced technologies, including platform screen doors and Communication-Based Train Control (CBTC) signaling, to ensure passenger safety and operational efficiency. The project is partially operational, with the Bandra Kurla Complex to Aarey section inaugurated on October 5, 2024.

name: Indira Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences
description: The Indira Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences (IGIMS) is a premier public medical institution located in Patna, Bihar, India. Established on November 19, 1983, under the State Legislature Act, IGIMS was modeled after the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi, with the objective of providing super-specialty medical care and reducing the patient load on other national institutes. The institute offers a wide range of academic programs, including MBBS, MD, MS, DM, M.Ch, DNB, Ph.D., and various paramedical courses. Admissions are primarily based on national-level entrance examinations such as NEET-UG for MBBS, NEET-PG for postgraduate courses, and NEET-SS for super-specialty programs. The IGIMS campus spans 131 acres on Bailey Road and currently houses approximately 1,070 beds, including a 100-bed Regional Cancer Institute. Expansion plans are underway to increase capacity to 2,500 beds, with ongoing construction of a 500-bed ultra-modern hospital and a 200-bed Regional Institute of Ophthalmology. IGIMS is recognized by the National Medical Commission (NMC), University Grants Commission (UGC), and the Association of Indian Universities (AIU), and is affiliated with the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Bihar.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi
description: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi, is a premier public medical research university and hospital located in New Delhi, India. Established in 1956 under the AIIMS Act, it operates autonomously under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. AIIMS Delhi is renowned for its excellence in medical education, research, and patient care. The institute offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various medical and allied health sciences. With a sprawling urban campus of over 213 acres, AIIMS Delhi houses state-of-the-art facilities, including specialized research centers and a comprehensive hospital complex. The institute is consistently ranked among the top medical institutions in India and holds the status of an Institute of National Importance.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Patna
description: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Patna, is a premier medical college and hospital located in Patna, Bihar. Established in 2012 as part of the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY), AIIMS Patna is one of the new AIIMS institutions aimed at correcting regional imbalances in healthcare services and education. It operates autonomously under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and super-specialty medical courses. AIIMS Patna is dedicated to providing top-tier medical education, advanced healthcare, and cutting-edge research in the field of medicine.

name: Government of Bihar
description: The Government of Bihar is the governing authority of the Indian state of Bihar. It comprises the executive, led by the Governor and the Chief Minister, the legislative branch with the Bihar Legislative Assembly and Legislative Council, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, law and order, development programs, education, healthcare, infrastructure, and various other public services across the state. It operates through multiple departments and agencies to implement policies and schemes that contribute to the socio-economic development of Bihar.

name: National Insurance Company Limited
description: National Insurance Company Limited (NICL) is a state-owned general insurance company in India. Established in 1906 and nationalized in 1972, NICL operates under the ownership of the Ministry of Finance, Government of India. Headquartered in Kolkata, it offers a wide range of insurance products including health, motor, property, and marine insurance. NICL plays a crucial role in the financial services sector by providing risk coverage and insurance solutions to individuals, businesses, and government entities across the country. It also conducts competitive recruitment exams for various administrative and officer-level positions.

name: Mahatma Gandhi Central University, Bihar
description: Mahatma Gandhi Central University, Bihar (MGCUB), is a central university established in 2016 and located in Motihari, Bihar. It operates under the Central Universities Act and is funded by the Government of India. MGCUB offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across diverse disciplines including humanities, sciences, social sciences, commerce, and management. The university aims to provide quality higher education and research opportunities while promoting academic excellence and inclusive development. It holds the status of a Central University and contributes to expanding access to higher education in the region.

name: Ministry of Women & Child Development
description: The Ministry of Women & Child Development is a branch of the Government of India responsible for formulating and implementing policies and programs focusing on the welfare and empowerment of women and children. It oversees schemes related to health, education, nutrition, safety, and protection, such as the Beti Bachao Beti Padhao initiative and Integrated Child Protection Scheme. Operating through a network of state and district-level bodies, the Ministry works towards ensuring gender equality, child rights, and overall social security in India.

name: Central Council for Research in Homoeopathy
description: The Central Council for Research in Homoeopathy (CCRH) is an autonomous organization under the Ministry of AYUSH, Government of India. Established in 1978, CCRH is responsible for the formulation, coordination, development, and promotion of research in Homoeopathy. It undertakes clinical, drug, and fundamental research and operates a network of research institutes and centers across the country. The council also contributes to policy development, standardization of homoeopathic medicines, and public health initiatives. CCRH plays a critical role in advancing scientific evidence for Homoeopathy in India.

name: Department of Health and Family Welfare
description: The Department of Health and Family Welfare (DHFW) is a government body responsible for implementing public health policies, programs, and services at both central and state levels in India. Its core functions include managing healthcare delivery systems, maternal and child health services, disease control programs, immunization drives, and family planning initiatives. DHFW works through a network of hospitals, primary health centers, and outreach programs to ensure accessible and affordable healthcare for all citizens. It plays a vital role in strengthening the country's public health infrastructure and improving health outcomes.

name: Sports Authority of India
description: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) is the apex national sports body responsible for the promotion of sports and the development of sporting talent in India. Established in 1984 under the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Government of India, SAI manages various sports training centers, including National Centres of Excellence and Sports Hostels. It provides infrastructure, coaching, and financial support to athletes across disciplines. SAI also implements key government sports schemes such as Khelo India and contributes significantly to India's performance in national and international competitions.

name: Life Insurance Corporation of India
description: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) is a state-owned insurance and investment corporation, established in 1956 and headquartered in Mumbai. Operating under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India, LIC is the largest life insurance company in India. It offers a wide range of life insurance products, pension plans, and investment services to individuals and groups. LIC plays a key role in financial inclusion and national economic development through its vast network of branches, agents, and digital services across the country.

name: Ferro Scrap Nigam Limited
description: Ferro Scrap Nigam Limited (FSNL) is a government-owned company under the Ministry of Steel, Government of India. Incorporated in 1979, FSNL is a subsidiary of MSTC Limited and specializes in the processing and recovery of scrap from slag and other allied activities in the steel sector. FSNL provides specialized services to major steel plants across India, including slag handling, metal recovery, and scrap management. It plays an essential role in improving efficiency, sustainability, and environmental practices in the steel manufacturing industry.

name: Ministry of Education
description: The Ministry of Education (MoE) is a branch of the Government of India responsible for the formulation and administration of the rules, regulations, and laws relating to education in India. Established in 1985 (formerly known as the Ministry of Human Resource Development until 2020), it oversees all aspects of school and higher education, including policy formulation, funding, assessment, accreditation, and regulation through bodies like UGC, AICTE, and NCERT. The Ministry promotes accessible, equitable, and quality education across the country.

name: National Institute of Technology, Andhra Pradesh
description: The National Institute of Technology Andhra Pradesh (NIT Andhra Pradesh) is an autonomous public technical university located in Tadepalligudem, West Godavari district. Established in 2015 and designated as an Institute of National Importance, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. The institute offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, and sciences. NIT Andhra Pradesh is committed to academic excellence, research innovation, industry collaboration, and overall technical education, with modern infrastructure and multidisciplinary laboratories.

name: Government of Andhra Pradesh
description: The Government of Andhra Pradesh is the administrative body governing the state of Andhra Pradesh in India. It consists of the executive, led by the Governor and Chief Minister, the bicameral legislature (Legislative Assembly and Legislative Council), and the judiciary. The government is responsible for law and order, public administration, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, and welfare programs. It functions through various departments and agencies to implement state policies, flagship schemes, and development initiatives aimed at enhancing socio-economic progress in the region.

name: Hindustan Shipyard Limited
description: Hindustan Shipyard Limited (HSL) is a premier government-owned shipbuilding and maintenance facility under the Ministry of Defence, Government of India. Established in 1941 in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, HSL specializes in constructing, repairing, and overhauling naval and commercial vessels. It provides critical ship repair services to the Indian Navy and Coast Guard, and manufactures essential marine equipment and platforms. With dry docks, workshops, and skilled workforce, HSL plays a strategic role in supporting India's maritime defense and commercial shipping capabilities.

name: Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy
description: The Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy (IIPE), located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is an Institute of National Importance established in 2016 under the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in petroleum and energy engineering. IIPE focuses on advanced research, industry collaboration, and technical education in areas such as petroleum exploration, petrochemical engineering, renewable energy, and sustainable energy systems. The institute aims to address India's energy sector needs by developing skilled professionals and cuttingedge technologies.

name: Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation of India Limited
description: Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation of India Limited (TRIFED) is a national-level apex organization under the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India. Established in 1987, TRIFED is dedicated to promoting tribal products, ensuring fair trade practices, and empowering tribal communities through marketing support and capacity building. It operates the 'TRIBES India' brand, organizes exhibitions, and facilitates the development of sustainable livelihoods for tribal artisans and forest dwellers. TRIFED plays a vital role in tribal welfare and inclusive economic development.

name: Department of Atomic Energy
description: The Department of Atomic Energy (DAE) is a key government department under the direct control of the Prime Minister of India. Established in 1954, DAE is responsible for nuclear energy production, atomic research, and the development of nuclear technology for peaceful purposes. It oversees institutions like BARC, NPCIL, IGCAR, and TIFR, contributing to areas such as energy, healthcare, agriculture, and advanced scientific research. DAE plays a crucial role in India's strategic capabilities and technological advancement.

name: Government of Tamil Nadu
description: The Government of Tamil Nadu is the governing authority of the state of Tamil Nadu, India. It comprises the executive (headed by the Governor and the Chief Minister), the unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, public services, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, law and order, and welfare schemes. It functions through various departments and municipalities to implement state-level policies and initiatives for socio-economic growth.

name: National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli
description: National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli (NIT Trichy) is one of Indias premier autonomous technical universities, located in Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu. Founded in 1964 as Regional Engineering College and granted the status of Institute of National Importance in 2003, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. NIT Trichy offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, science, architecture, and management. Renowned for its robust academic curriculum, cutting-edge research, and industry collaboration, it consistently ranks among the top NITs in the country.

name: Chennai Metro Rail Limited
description: Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) is a joint venture between the Government of India and the Government of Tamil Nadu responsible for implementing and operating the Chennai Metro. Established in 2007, CMRL plans, constructs, and manages metro rail infrastructure and services aimed at improving urban mobility in Chennai. It oversees project execution from civil works to signalling and train operations, and plays a key role in enhancing public transportation, reducing traffic congestion, and promoting sustainable urban development.

name: Department of Financial Services
description: The Department of Financial Services (DFS) is part of the Ministry of Finance, Government of India. It oversees banking, insurance, pension reforms, and financial inclusion initiatives. DFS regulates and formulates policies for public sector banks, private banks, non-banking financial companies, insurance firms, and pension funds. It also implements flagship programs such as Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana, Atal Pension Yojana, and provides administrative oversight to institutions like RBI, IRDAI, and pension regulators.

name: Ministry of Defence
description: The Ministry of Defence (MoD) is a key ministry under the Government of India responsible for maintaining and managing the country's defense and armed forces. It oversees the Indian Army, Navy, Air Force, Coast Guard, and several Defence Public Sector Undertakings (DPSUs). The MoD formulates policies, allocates budgets, and coordinates national security efforts, procurement, research, and defense manufacturing. It works to ensure the territorial integrity and strategic interests of India both domestically and internationally.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Rishikesh
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Rishikesh, is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand. Established in 2012 under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana and operating under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India, AIIMS Rishikesh provides high-quality medical education, patient care, and research. The institute offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various medical and allied health disciplines. It is equipped with modern clinical facilities, advanced diagnostic services, and specialized departments, serving as a key healthcare hub in the region.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee
description: Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (IIT Roorkee) is an autonomous public technical and research university located in Roorkee, Uttarakhand. Established in 1847 as the College of Civil Engineering and later designated as an IIT in 2001, it is one of Indias oldest and premier engineering institutions. Functioning under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, IIT Roorkee offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, architecture, sciences, management, and humanities. It is renowned for its strong academic curriculum, innovative research initiatives, industry partnerships, and contributions to national and global technological advancement.

name: Government of Uttarakhand
description: The Government of Uttarakhand is the governing authority of the state of Uttarakhand, India. It comprises the executive (headed by the Governor and Chief Minister), the unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, public services, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, environment, disaster management, and welfare programs. It operates through various departments and agencies to implement state policies, schemes, and initiatives for sustainable socio-economic development in the region.

name: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
description: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) is a central government ministry responsible for planning, promoting, coordinating, and overseeing environmental and forestry programmes in India. It formulates national policies, legislation, and regulations for the conservation of natural resources, protection of the environment, and sustainable development. The ministry also implements and monitors various biodiversity, climate change mitigation, pollution control, and afforestation initiatives through its departments and subordinate bodies.

name: Indian Institute of Management Kashipur
description: The Indian Institute of Management Kashipur (IIM Kashipur) is a premier public business school located in Kashipur, Uttarakhand. Established in 2011 under the Indian Institutes of Management Act and operating under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, IIM Kashipur offers postgraduate, doctoral, and executive programs in management. The institute emphasizes rigorous academic curriculum, high-quality research, industry engagement, and leadership development. It is renowned for its state-of-the-art campus facilities and strong placement records, contributing significantly to India's management education landscape.

name: National Institute of Technology, Uttarakhand
description: National Institute of Technology Uttarakhand (NIT Uttarakhand) is an autonomous public technical institute located in Srinagar, Uttarakhand. Established in 2009 and designated as an Institute of National Importance under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, it offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, sciences, and technology. The institute focuses on quality technical education, research, and innovation, and is equipped with modern laboratories, classrooms, and collaborative industry linkages.

name: Government of Uttar Pradesh
description: The Government of Uttar Pradesh is the governing authority of the state of Uttar Pradesh, India. It comprises the executive (headed by the Governor and the Chief Minister), the unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, public services, infrastructure development, law and order, education, healthcare, agriculture, and welfare schemes. It functions through numerous departments and agencies to implement state-level policies and programs aimed at promoting socio-economic development across the state.

name: High Court of Allahabad
description: The High Court of Allahabad, established on 17 March 1866, is one of the oldest and largest high courts in India with jurisdiction over the state of Uttar Pradesh. Located in Allahabad (Prayagraj), it administers justice across civil, criminal, constitutional, and administrative matters. The High Court supervises subordinate courts, handles writ petitions, and serves as an appellate authority. It plays a pivotal role in upholding the rule of law and protecting individual rights within its jurisdiction.

name: Government of Rajasthan
description: The Government of Rajasthan is the governing authority of the state of Rajasthan, India. It comprises the executive branch (headed by the Governor and the Chief Minister), the unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, law and order, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, tourism, agriculture, and welfare programs. It operates through various departments and agencies to implement state-level policies and initiatives aimed at socioeconomic growth and cultural preservation in the region.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Raebareli
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Raebareli, is an autonomous public medical research university and hospital located in Raebareli, Uttar Pradesh. Approved in 2013 under the PMSSY Phase II initiative, it became operational in 2018 and began its first MBBS batch in 2019. Operating under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, AIIMS Raebareli offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), and doctoral programs. The sprawling campus spans approximately 148 acres and includes modern clinical, teaching, and research facilities. With a 750bed hospital, the institute emphasizes high-quality patient care, advanced medical education, and cutting-edge research.

name: Ministry of Civil Aviation
description: The Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) is the nodal ministry of the Government of India responsible for formulation of national policies and programmes for the development and regulation of the civil aviation sector in the country. It oversees air transport services, airport infrastructure, air safety, and air traffic services. MoCA also administers statutory bodies like the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and Airports Authority of India (AAI), aiming to ensure safe, efficient, and sustainable growth of civil aviation.

name: Ministry of Information and Broadcasting
description: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (MoIB) is the nodal ministry of the Government of India responsible for formulating and administering rules, regulations, and laws relating to information, broadcasting, the press, and films in India. It oversees content regulation for television and radio, administers public service broadcasting through Doordarshan and All India Radio, supports the film sector via the Film Division and the National Film Development Corporation, and implements the Press Information Bureau. The ministry also promotes film and media culture, awards, and film festivals.

name: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad
description: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology (MNNIT), Allahabad, is a premier public technical university located in Prayagraj (formerly Allahabad), Uttar Pradesh. Established in 1961 and designated as an Institute of National Importance, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. MNNIT offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, sciences, management, and humanities. The institute is recognized for its strong academic curriculum, research output, industry collaborations, and cultural vibrancy, contributing significantly to national technical education.

name: Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation
description: Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRCL) is a joint venture company of the Government of India and the Government of Uttar Pradesh, responsible for the implementation, operation, and maintenance of metro rail projects in the state, including Lucknow Metro and Kanpur Metro. Established in 2013 as UP Metro Rail Corporation Ltd., it coordinates planning, construction, and service delivery to enhance urban public transit infrastructure and mobility.

name: Indian Institute of Technology (BHU) Varanasi
description: Indian Institute of Technology (BHU) Varanasi, commonly known as IIT BHU, is a premier autonomous public technical and research university located in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh. Originally established in 1919 as the Banaras Engineering College and later merged with the Banaras Hindu University, it was designated as an IIT in 2012 under the Institutes of Technology Act. IIT BHU offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, sciences, humanities, and management. It is renowned for its strong academic curriculum, high-impact research, vibrant campus life, and significant contributions to Indias technical and scientific development.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Gorakhpur
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Gorakhpur, is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh. Announced under the PMSSY Phase IV initiative, it became operational in 2019 and admits its first MBBS cohort in 2020. Operating under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India, AIIMS Gorakhpur offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), and doctoral programs in various medical and allied health disciplines. The campus features modern teaching hospitals, advanced diagnostic services, and dedicated research facilities. The institute is committed to delivering high-quality medical education, specialized patient care, and impactful medical research in the region.

name: Uttar Pradesh Public Works Department
description: The Uttar Pradesh Public Works Department (UPPWD) is a state government department responsible for the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of public infrastructure assets such as roads, bridges, government buildings, irrigation systems, and other civil works within Uttar Pradesh. It undertakes major and minor engineering projects to support transportation, irrigation, fire safety, and administrative infrastructure. UPPWD ensures structural safety, adherence to engineering standards, and timely delivery of public works across the state.

name: Department of Space
description: The Department of Space (DoS) is a central government department under the Prime Minister's Office responsible for the planning, formulation, and implementation of space policy, training, and providing space services in India. Established in 1972, it oversees organizations such as the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre (VSSC), and Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC). DoS is tasked with satellite development, space exploration, launch vehicle missions, and satellite-based applications in fields like communication, remote sensing, navigation, and scientific research.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Jodhpur
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Jodhpur, is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Jodhpur, Rajasthan. Established in 2012 under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY), AIIMS Jodhpur operates under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India. The institute offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), super-specialty, and doctoral programs across various medical and allied health disciplines. With modern clinical facilities, dedicated research centers, and a comprehensive hospital complex, AIIMS Jodhpur is committed to excellence in medical education, patient care, and innovative healthcare research.

name: Indian Council of Medical Research
description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) is the apex body for the formulation, coordination, and promotion of biomedical research in India. Established in 1911 and functioning under the Department of Health Research, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India, ICMR supports and conducts research on communicable and noncommunicable diseases, reproduction, nutrition, immunology, and health systems. With a network of research institutes and centers, it plays a pivotal role in health policy development, public health preparedness, and the advancement of medical science in India.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee  Kota Campus
description: Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee  Kota Campus (commonly referred to as IIT Kota) is a satellite campus of IIT Roorkee located in Kota, Rajasthan. Established in 2023 under the Super-National Mission on Holistic Education (SNMHE), it aims to expand access to quality technical education in emerging cities. Affiliated to IIT Roorkee, IIT Kota offers undergraduate (BTech) and postgraduate (MTech, PhD) programs in engineering and applied sciences, leveraging the parent institutes academic framework, faculty, and research facilities.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Gandhinagar
description: Indian Institute of Technology Gandhinagar (IITGN) is a premier public technical and research university located in Gandhinagar, Gujarat. Established in 2008 as one of the eight new IITs, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IIT Gandhinagar offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, science, humanities, management, and design. Known for its interdisciplinary curriculum, innovative pedagogy, and commitment to sustainability and community engagement, IIT Gandhinagar is recognized for its excellence in research, innovation, and holistic education.

name: Government of Gujarat
description: The Government of Gujarat is the governing authority of the state of Gujarat, India. It comprises the executive (headed by the Governor and Chief Minister), unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, public services, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, law and order, industrial growth, and welfare schemes. It functions through a network of departments and agencies to implement state-level policies and initiatives aimed at promoting socio-economic development in the region.

name: Commissionerate of Higher Education, Gujarat
description: The Commissionerate of Higher Education (CoHEG) is the statelevel body under the Government of Gujarat responsible for the administration and oversight of higher education institutions in the state. It formulates policies, coordinates with universities, approves curricula and academic standards, and oversees examinations and accreditation for colleges and technical institutes. CoHEG also implements statelevel schemes for scholarship, quality assurance, and infrastructure development in higher education.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Rajkot
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Rajkot is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Rajkot, Gujarat. Established in 2020 under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY), it is one of the AIIMSplus institutions set up to provide advanced medical education and healthcare across underserved regions. Operating under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India, AIIMS Rajkot offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), and soon doctoral programs in various medical and allied health sciences. The institute aims to deliver high-quality patient care, cutting-edge research, and specialized medical training to strengthen regional health infrastructure.

name: Ministry of Labour and Employment
description: The Ministry of Labour and Employment (MoLE) is a central government ministry in India responsible for promoting gainful employment, protecting workers rights, and ensuring appropriate working conditions. It oversees labour laws, national employment services, industrial relations, social security schemes like Employees Provident Fund (EPF) and Employees State Insurance (ESI), and implements skill development and welfare programs across the organized and unorganized sectors.

name: Ministry of Commerce and Industry
description: The Ministry of Commerce and Industry (MoCI) is a central government ministry in India responsible for formulating and implementing policies related to foreign and domestic trade, industrial development, export promotion, and economic engagement. It oversees departments such as the Department of Commerce (including DGFT), the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), and agencies like the ExportImport Bank of India. The ministry works to enhance Indias global trade competitiveness, attract investments, foster industrial growth, and support small- and medium-sized enterprises.

name: Ministry of Science and Technology
description: The Ministry of Science and Technology (MoST) is a central government ministry in India responsible for promoting scientific research, innovation, and technological development across various sectors. It oversees key departments such as the Department of Science and Technology (DST), Department of Biotechnology (DBT), and Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR). MoST funds and supports national laboratories, research institutions, and science-based policy initiatives aimed at advancing India's scientific capabilities and fostering innovation-driven growth.

name: Government of Kerala
description: The Government of Kerala is the governing authority of the state of Kerala, India. It comprises the executive branch headed by the Governor and Chief Minister, the unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, law and order, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, tourism, and implementation of welfare schemes. It operates through various departments and public sector undertakings to drive socio-economic growth and sustainable development in the state.

name: Kannur International Airport
description: Kannur International Airport is an international airport serving Kannur, Kasaragod, and surrounding regions in north Kerala. It commenced operations in December 2018 and is operated by Kannur International Airport Limited (KIAL), a company promoted by the Government of Kerala and the Airports Authority of India. The airport features modern terminal facilities, cargo handling infrastructure, and serves domestic and international flights, enhancing connectivity and supporting regional economic growth.

name: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
description: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) is a central government ministry in India responsible for policy formulation, regulation, and promotion in the areas of electronics, information technology, digital services, and the internet. It oversees initiatives related to egovernance, cybersecurity, digital infrastructure (such as UIDAI and Digital India), semiconductor policy, innovation ecosystems, and software exports. MeitY operates through organizations like the Controller of Certifying Authorities (CCA), National Informatics Centre (NIC), CERTIn, and others to drive Indias digital transformation agenda.

name: Ministry of Heavy Industries
description: The Ministry of Heavy Industries (MHI) is a central government ministry in India responsible for the promotion, development, and regulation of heavy engineering industries. It oversees public sector undertakings such as Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL), Heavy Engineering Corporation (HEC), and Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited (TAFE). MHI formulates policies, supports industrial modernization, and implements schemes to enhance manufacturing capabilities, quality, and competitiveness in the heavy industry sector.

name: National Medical Commission
description: The National Medical Commission (NMC) is the apex regulatory body for medical education and professionals in India. Established in 2020 under the National Medical Commission Act, it replaced the Medical Council of India. NMC is responsible for setting policies for medical education, accrediting institutions, overseeing registration of medical practitioners, and conducting the National Exit Test (NExT). It aims to improve access to quality healthcare through better standards in education and ethical medical practice.

name: Government of Maharashtra
description: The Government of Maharashtra is the governing authority of the state of Maharashtra, India. It consists of the executive branch (headed by the Governor and the Chief Minister), a bicameral legislature (Vidhan Sabha and Vidhan Parishad), and the judiciary. The government is responsible for policy-making and administration in sectors like education, healthcare, transportation, agriculture, industry, infrastructure, and law and order. Through its various departments and agencies, the Government of Maharashtra implements welfare programs and drives economic and social development in the state.

name: Advanced Centre for Treatment, Research and Education in Cancer
description: The Advanced Centre for Treatment, Research and Education in Cancer (ACTREC) is a premier national institution operated by the Tata Memorial Centre under the Department of Atomic Energy, Government of India. Located in Navi Mumbai, it focuses on cutting-edge research in cancer biology, clinical oncology, and cancer prevention. ACTREC also provides specialized cancer treatment services and offers educational programs including MD, DM, and PhD degrees in oncology. It plays a vital role in advancing cancer care and research in India.

name: Department of Revenue
description: The Department of Revenue (DoR) functions under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India, and is responsible for the formulation and implementation of policies concerning direct and indirect taxes. It supervises two key statutory boardsthe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) and the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC). DoR manages tax collection, prevents tax evasion and smuggling, and oversees legal and policy frameworks related to revenue administration.

name: Indian Institute of Management Nagpur
description: Indian Institute of Management Nagpur (IIM Nagpur) is a premier public business school located in Nagpur, Maharashtra. Established in 2015 as part of the second generation of new IIMs, it operates under the Indian Institutes of Management Act and is overseen by the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IIM Nagpur offers postgraduate (PGP), executive, and doctoral programs in management. The institute emphasizes experiential learning, research-driven pedagogy, and strong industry linkages, making it a key player in Indias management education landscape.

name: Securities and Exchange Board of India
description: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is Indias statutory regulatory authority for the securities market, established in 1988 and granted statutory status in 1992 under the SEBI Act. Operating under the Ministry of Finance, SEBIs mandate is to protect investors interests, promote market development, and regulate intermediaries such as stock exchanges, brokers, mutual funds, and depositories. It possesses quasi-legislative, quasi-judicial, and quasi-executive powers to ensure transparent, fair, and efficient capital markets.

name: Ministry of Home Affairs
description: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) is a key ministry under the Government of India responsible for the maintenance of internal security, border management, center-state relations, disaster management, and the administration of Union Territories. It oversees organizations like the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs), National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), Intelligence Bureau (IB), and National Investigation Agency (NIA). MHA formulates policies related to law and order, citizenship, immigration, and national integration.

name: Directorate of Medical Education and Research, Maharashtra
description: The Directorate of Medical Education and Research (DMER), Maharashtra, was established in 1970 and operates under the states Ministry of Medical Education. It supervises government medical, dental, and nursing colleges and teaching hospitals, overseeing undergraduate, postgraduate, and super-specialty academic standards, conduct of the MHCET entrance exam, and coordination of clinical research. In 2025, DMER launched a major recruitment drive to fill 792 faculty and 10 dean posts in government medical colleges to address staff shortages following showcause notices by the National Medical Commission :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}.

name: Indian Institute of Management Mumbai
description: Indian Institute of Management Mumbai (IIM Mumbai) is the 21st Indian Institute of Management, established by upgrading the National Institute of Industrial Engineering (NITIE) in 2023. Located in Mumbai, Maharashtra, IIM Mumbai is recognized as a premier institution for management education and research, particularly in the fields of industrial management, operations, and supply chain. It operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, and offers postgraduate, doctoral, and executive programs in management, with a focus on industry relevance and innovation.

name: Bank of Maharashtra
description: Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) is a major public sector bank headquartered in Pune, Maharashtra. Established in 1935, it operates under the ownership of the Government of India. BoM provides a wide range of banking services including retail, corporate, agriculture, and MSME banking. With an extensive network of branches and ATMs across India, the bank plays a significant role in financial inclusion and regional development.

name: Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited
description: Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MAHA Metro) is a joint venture between the Government of India and the Government of Maharashtra tasked with the implementation, operation, and maintenance of metro rail projects across the state. Established in 2015, MAHA Metro is responsible for overseeing rapid transit systems including Nagpur Metro, Pune Metro, and planning new corridors. It manages planning, construction, signaling, train operations, and metro services to enhance urban mobility and sustainable public transportation across Maharashtra.

name: Ministry of Mines
description: The Ministry of Mines (MoM) is a central government ministry in India responsible for the survey, exploration, and development of all minerals (excluding natural gas, petroleum, and atomic minerals). It formulates and implements policies related to mining and mineral conservation and oversees key organizations such as the Geological Survey of India (GSI), Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM), and mineral-based Public Sector Undertakings. The ministry plays a vital role in promoting sustainable mining practices and supporting India's resource security and industrial development.

name: Department of Personnel & Training
description: The Department of Personnel & Training (DoPT) is a central government department under the Prime Ministers Office. It serves as the cadre-controlling authority for the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) and Central Secretariat Service (CSS), and oversees recruitment, training, service conditions, and performance management of central government employees. DoPT also issues policies related to government staffing, vigilance, official language, and e-governance, and coordinates major initiatives such as the Central Training Institutes and the Fundamental Rights-based policy frameworks.

name: Mineral Exploration Company Limited
description: Mineral Exploration Company Limited (MECL) is a public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Mines, Government of India. Established in 1965, MECL performs reconnaissance, exploration, and detailed investigation of mineral resources across the country. The company contributes to the development of geological data, survey reports, and feasibility studies for various metallic, non-metallic, and energy minerals. MECL plays a key role in supporting Indias mineral policy, exploration strategies, and sustainable resource management.

name: Ministry of Railways
description: The Ministry of Railways (MoR) is a central government ministry in India responsible for the formulation and administration of policies, planning, and development of the Indian Railways. It oversees rail infrastructure, operations, and safety standards, and manages a vast network of routes and services across the country. MoR operates key organizations including the Railway Board, Indian Railways, and public sector undertakings like IRCTC and RITES. The ministry plays a crucial role in transportation, economic growth, and connectivity.

name: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying
description: The Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying (MoFAD) is a central government ministry in India, formed in May 2019. It is responsible for the development and regulation of the fisheries, livestock, and dairy sectors. The ministry formulates policies and implements programs to improve production, productivity, infrastructure, and socio-economic growth of fishermen, livestock rearers, and dairy farmers. Key schemes include Blue Revolution, National Livestock Mission, and the Animal Husbandry Infrastructure Development Fund.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Ropar
description: Indian Institute of Technology Ropar (IIT Ropar) is a premier autonomous public technical and research university located in Rupnagar (Ropar), Punjab. Established in 2008 as one of the new IITs, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IIT Ropar offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, sciences, humanities, and management. The institute is recognized for its strong academic curriculum, interdisciplinary research, innovation-focused initiatives, and vibrant campus culture.

name: Punjab State Legal Services Authority
description: The Punjab State Legal Services Authority (PSLSA) is a statutory body established under the Legal Services Authorities Act, 1987, functioning under the Department of Law, Government of Punjab. PSLSA provides free legal services to the underprivileged and marginalized, organizes Lok Adalats for speedy resolution of disputes, and conducts legal awareness programs across the state. It plays a vital role in ensuring access to justice, promoting legal literacy, and facilitating alternative dispute resolution mechanisms in Punjab.

name: Government of Punjab
description: The Government of Punjab is the governing authority of the state of Punjab, India. It comprises the executive branch (headed by the Governor and Chief Minister), the unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for law and order, public administration, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, industry, and implementation of welfare schemes. It operates through various departments and agencies to drive socio-economic growth and ensure public services across the state.

name: Ministry of Steel
description: The Ministry of Steel (MoS) is a central government ministry in India responsible for the development, regulation, and coordination of the iron and steel industry. It formulates policies to promote growth, technological advancement, and sustainable practices within the sector. The ministry oversees major public sector undertakings such as Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL), Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL), and NMDC. MoS plays a crucial role in ensuring raw material security, enhancing capacity utilization, and supporting research and innovation in steel production.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Bathinda
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Bathinda is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Bathinda, Punjab. Announced under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana Phase IV, it became operational in 2019 and admitted its first MBBS batch in 2020. Operating under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India, AIIMS Bathinda offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), and doctoral programs in various medical and allied health sciences. The campus features modern clinical, diagnostic, and research facilities, and is committed to delivering high-quality healthcare, medical education, and research in the region.

name: Punjab and Haryana High Court
description: The Punjab and Haryana High Court is the common high court for the Indian states of Punjab and Haryana and the union territory of Chandigarh. Established in 1919 and located in Chandigarh, it has jurisdiction over civil, criminal, constitutional, and administrative matters. The court supervises subordinate courts in both states and handles appeals, writ petitions, and special leave petitions. It plays a crucial role in upholding the rule of law, protecting individual rights, and interpreting constitutional provisions within its jurisdiction.

name: National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur
description: National Institute of Technology Hamirpur (NIT Hamirpur) is an autonomous public technical university located in Hamirpur, Himachal Pradesh. Established in 1986 as a Regional Engineering College, it was granted Institute of National Importance status under the Ministry of Education in 2002. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, and sciences, with strong focus on research, innovation, and industry partnerships. NIT Hamirpur is known for its quality academic curriculum, modern infrastructure, and contributions to engineering education in the region.

name: Indian Institute of Management Bangalore
description: Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIM Bangalore or IIMB) is a premier autonomous public business school located in Bengaluru, Karnataka. Established in 1973 through an Act of Parliament, it operates under the Indian Institutes of Management Act and functions under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IIM Bangalore offers postgraduate (PGP, PGPPGDM), executive, doctoral, and specialized management programs. Known for its global curriculum, rigorous research, strong industry linkages, and vibrant campus, IIMB consistently ranks among the top management institutions in India and Asia.

name: Ministry of Tribal Affairs
description: The Ministry of Tribal Affairs (MoTA) is a central government ministry in India responsible for policy formulation, planning, and administration concerning the welfare and development of the Scheduled Tribes community. It oversees schemes related to education, livelihood, health, infrastructure, and cultural preservation for tribal populations. MoTA administers initiatives such as the Post Matric Scholarship Scheme, Tribal Sub-Plan, Vanbandhu Kalyan Yojana, and supports Tribal Research Institutes and the National Commission for Scheduled Tribes.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Bhubaneswar
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Bhubaneswar is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Established in 2012 under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY), it operates under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India. AIIMS Bhubaneswar offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), super-specialty, and doctoral programs in various medical and allied health sciences. The campus includes advanced clinical facilities, research laboratories, and a 1000+ bed hospital, focusing on excellence in patient care, medical education, and cutting-edge research.

name: Government of Odisha
description: The Government of Odisha (GoO) is the governing authority of the Indian state of Odisha. It consists of the executive branch led by the Governor and Chief Minister, the legislative branch with a unicameral legislature, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, development, and implementation of policies across various sectors such as education, health, infrastructure, agriculture, and industry. Through its departments and agencies, GoO works to promote socio-economic development and ensure public service delivery across the state.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar
description: Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar (IIT Bhubaneswar) is a premier autonomous public technical and research university located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Established in 2008 as one of the new IITs, it functions under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. The institute offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, science, humanities, and management. Known for its strong academic curriculum, interdisciplinary research, modern infrastructure, and innovation-focused initiatives, IIT Bhubaneswar is recognized as an Institute of National Importance and contributes significantly to technical education and research.

name: Odisha Hydro Power Corporation
description: Odisha Hydro Power Corporation (OHPC) is a state-owned power generation company under the Government of Odisha. Established in 1995, OHPC is responsible for the operation and maintenance of hydroelectric plants and generation of renewable energy in the state. It manages major projects such as Upper Kolab, Balimela, and Upper Indravati, contributing significantly to Odisha's power supply and sustainable energy initiatives.

name: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
description: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MoPNG) is a central government ministry in India responsible for the formulation and implementation of policies related to petroleum, natural gas, petrochemicals, and oil & gas infrastructure. It oversees exploration and production, refining, distribution, marketing, and imports of oil and gas. The ministry regulates and coordinates public sector undertakings such as Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC), Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL), and GAIL (India), and promotes investment in the energy sector.

name: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing
description: The Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing (IIITDM) is a group of premier technical institutions in India focused on integrated education, design-led engineering, and manufacturing innovation. Operating under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, IIITDM campusessuch as those in Kancheepuram (Tamil Nadu), Jabalpur (Madhya Pradesh), and Kurnool (Andhra Pradesh)offer undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in information technology, design, manufacturing, and related engineering disciplines. They emphasize interdisciplinary curriculum, human-centered design, and industry collaboration.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Indore
description: Indian Institute of Technology Indore (IIT Indore) is a premier autonomous public technical and research university located in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. Established in 2009 as one of the new IITs under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, it has been designated as an Institute of National Importance. IIT Indore offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various engineering, technology, science, and management disciplines. Known for its cutting-edge research, interdisciplinary curriculum, and modern campus infrastructure, it consistently ranks among the top IITs in India.

name: Indian Institute of Information Technology and Management, Gwalior
description: Indian Institute of Information Technology and Management, Gwalior (IIITM Gwalior), also known as ABV-IIITM, is a premier autonomous public technical and research university located in Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh. Established in 1997 under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, it specializes in offering postgraduate, doctoral, and integrated programs in information technology, management, and application development. The institute focuses on advanced research, industry collaboration, and interdisciplinary education, contributing significantly to national initiatives in digital innovation and technology leadership.

name: Indira Gandhi National Tribal University
description: Indira Gandhi National Tribal University (IGNTU) is a central university located in Amarkantak, Madhya Pradesh. Established in 2007 by an Act of Parliament, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IGNTU focuses on tribal-centric education, offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in disciplines such as humanities, social sciences, tribal art and culture, languages, and environmental studies. The university aims to promote higher education, preserve tribal heritage, and foster socio-economic development among India's indigenous communities.

name: Indian Council of Forestry Research and Education
description: The Indian Council of Forestry Research and Education (ICFRE) is an autonomous organization under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Government of India. Established in 1986 and headquartered in Dehradun, ICFRE is the apex body for coordinating, guiding, and managing research and education in forestry. It operates a network of regional research institutes and centers focused on forest management, biodiversity conservation, and sustainable forestry. ICFRE supports capacity building, policy advice, and the dissemination of scientific knowledge to help conserve forests and enhance forest-based livelihoods.

name: Government of Madhya Pradesh
description: The Government of Madhya Pradesh is the governing authority of the state of Madhya Pradesh, India. It comprises the executive branch (headed by the Governor and Chief Minister), a unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for administration, public services, law and order, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, industry, and welfare initiatives. It functions through various state departments and agencies to drive socio-economic development and ensure effective public service delivery throughout the state.

name: Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology, Bhopal
description: Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT), Bhopal is an autonomous public technical university located in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. Established in 1960 as Maulana Azad College of Technology, it was granted the status of an Institute of National Importance in 2002. MANIT offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, architecture, science, and management. Recognized for its strong academic curriculum, research contributions, and industry collaboration, the institute plays a significant role in nurturing technical education and innovation.

name: Indian Institute of Management Indore
description: Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) is a premier autonomous public business school located in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. Established in 1996 and recognized under the Indian Institutes of Management Act, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IIM Indore offers postgraduate, doctoral, and executive education programs in management, known for its rigorous curriculum, strong research focus, vibrant campus culture, and high placement records. It is consistently ranked among the top IIMs in the country.

name: Government of Haryana
description: The Government of Haryana is the governing authority of the state of Haryana, India. It comprises the executive branch (headed by the Governor and Chief Minister), a unicameral Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The state government is responsible for public administration, law and order, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, industry promotion, and welfare schemes. It functions through various departments and agencies to deliver socio-economic development across urban and rural areas.

name: Ministry of Jal Shakti
description: The Ministry of Jal Shakti (MoJS) is a central government ministry in India formed in 2019 by merging the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development & Ganga Rejuvenation and the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation. It is responsible for the planning, development, and management of water resources, river basin management, irrigation, flood control, drinking water supply, and sanitation. The ministry oversees flagship programs like the Jal Jeevan Mission, Atal Bhujal Yojana, and Namami Gange, aiming to ensure sustainable water supply and sanitation across the country.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Tirupati
description: Indian Institute of Technology Tirupati (IIT Tirupati) is a premier autonomous public technical and research university located in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. It was established in 2015 as one of the new IITs and functions under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. The institute offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, sciences, and interdisciplinary areas. IIT Tirupati emphasizes quality education, research innovation, sustainability, and industry engagement, with modern infrastructure and skilled faculty, and is designated as an Institute of National Importance.

name: National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission
description: The National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC) is a quasi-judicial commission established under the Consumer Protection Act, 1986, with jurisdiction over India. Headquartered in New Delhi, NCDRC addresses consumer complaints and appeals involving goods and services, adjudicating higher-value disputes and ensuring enforcement of consumer rights. Serving as the apex consumer forum, it reviews decisions of State Commissions and contributes to strengthening consumer protection through legal rulings and guidance.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Madurai
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Madurai is an autonomous public medical university and hospital located in Madurai, Tamil Nadu. Approved under PMSSY Phase IV and operational since 2024, AIIMS Madurai functions under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India. The institute offers undergraduate (MBBS), postgraduate (MD/MS), and doctoral programs in various medical and allied health sciences. The campus includes modern clinical, diagnostic, and research facilities, and provides high-quality patient care, medical education, and healthcare research to serve the region.

name: Gas Authority of India Limited
description: Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL) is the largest state-owned natural gas processing and distribution company in India. Established in 1984, it operates under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India. GAILs core operations include natural gas processing, transmission through pipeline networks, LNG regasification, petrochemicals, city gas distribution, and exploration & production. The company plays a vital role in Indias energy security, infrastructure development, and the transition toward cleaner fuel usage.

name: Ministry of AYUSH
description: The Ministry of AYUSH is a central government ministry in India responsible for the development, promotion, and regulation of traditional systems of medicine including Ayurveda, Yoga & Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha, and Homoeopathy. It formulates policies, standards, and research frameworks, and supports educational institutions, public health programs, and clinical research in traditional medicine. The ministry oversees organizations such as CCRAS, CCRUM, and CCRH to further integrate AYUSH into India's healthcare ecosystem.

name: Ministry of Cooperation
description: The Ministry of Cooperation is a central government ministry in India, constituted in July 2021. It is responsible for strengthening the cooperative movement, formulating policies and legislation for cooperative societies, and ensuring seamless working of cooperatives across sectors such as agriculture, credit, housing, dairy, and consumer services. The ministry oversees the implementation of initiatives like the National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC), promotes capacity-building among cooperative institutions, and ensures their alignment with national economic and social objectives.

name: Indian Bank
description: Indian Bank is a public sector bank headquartered in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. Established in 1907, it operates under the ownership of the Government of India. The bank offers a comprehensive range of banking and financial services including retail banking, corporate banking, NRI services, and digital banking solutions. With an extensive branch network and ATMs across India, Indian Bank plays a significant role in financial inclusion, providing credit support to agriculture, MSME, and rural sectors.

name: Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode
description: Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode (IIM Kozhikode or IIMK) is a premier autonomous public business school located in Kozhikode, Kerala. Established in 1996 through an Act of Parliament, it operates under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. IIM Kozhikode offers postgraduate (PGP), executive, and doctoral programs in management. Renowned for its rigorous academic curriculum, research-driven pedagogy, strong industry linkages, and vibrant campus life, it is consistently ranked among India's top management institutes.

name: Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers
description: The Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers (MoCF) is a central government ministry in India responsible for the formulation and implementation of policies related to the chemical and fertilizer industries. It oversees production, quality control, pricing, and distribution of fertilizers; regulates bulk drug and pharmaceuticals; and promotes chemical safety and environmental protection. The ministry administers key entities such as the Fertilizer Corporation of India, IOCs Chemical Division, and the Central Institute of Petrochemicals Engineering & Technology (CIPET).

name: Ministry of Earth Sciences
description: The Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES) is a central government ministry in India responsible for monitoring and predicting Earth systems, including weather, climate, oceans, and seismology. It oversees institutions like the India Meteorological Department (IMD), National Centre for Medium Range Weather Forecasting (NCMRWF), Indian National Centre for Ocean Information Services (INCOIS), and National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT). MoES provides critical services such as weather forecasting, cyclone warnings, tsunami alerts, climate research, and supports maritime mandates and disaster preparedness.

name: Rajkot Nagarik Sahakari Bank
description: Rajkot Nagarik Sahakari Bank (RNSB) is a cooperative bank based in Rajkot, Gujarat. Established to serve the urban and semi-urban communities, it provides a variety of banking services including savings and current accounts, fixed deposits, loans (personal, business, and housing), and digital banking facilities. Regulated by the Reserve Bank of India under the Gujarat State Cooperative Societies Act, RNSB focuses on promoting financial inclusion and supporting local development.

name: Government of Karnataka
description: The Government of Karnataka is the governing authority of the state of Karnataka, India. It comprises the executive branch led by the Governor and Chief Minister, the Legislative Assembly, and the judiciary. The government is responsible for law and order, infrastructure development, education, healthcare, agriculture, industry, and the implementation of welfare schemes. It functions through various state departments and agencies to deliver public services and drive socio-economic development across the state.

name: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited
description: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) is a joint venture between the Government of India and the Government of Karnataka. Established in 2007, BMRCL is tasked with the planning, execution, operation, and maintenance of the Namma Metro system in Bengaluru. It oversees all aspects of the metro network, including civil construction, signalling, train operations, and passenger services, to enhance urban mobility and reduce congestion in the city.

name: National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences
description: The National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) is a premier autonomous medical institute located in Bengaluru, Karnataka. Established in 1974, it functions under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India. NIMHANS is recognized for its excellence in mental health and neurosciences, offering postgraduate, doctoral, and super-specialty programs in psychiatry, clinical psychology, neurosurgery, neurology, and allied disciplines. It also provides patient care, training, research, and policy advice, and holds the status of an Institute of National Importance in its domain.

name: National Institute of Technology Karnataka
description: National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK), also known as NITK Surathkal, is a premier autonomous technical university located in Surathkal, Karnataka. Established in 1960 and designated as an Institute of National Importance, it functions under the Ministry of Education, Government of India. NITK offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, technology, sciences, architecture, and management. It is renowned for its strong academic curriculum, cutting-edge research, and robust industry collaborations.

name: Ministry of Women & Child Development
description: The Ministry of Women & Child Development (MoWCD) is a central government ministry in India responsible for formulating and implementing policies and programs focused on the welfare, protection, and empowerment of women and children. It administers schemes such as BetiBachaoBetiPadhao, Integrated Child Protection Scheme, and PradhanMantriMatruVandanaYojana, and enforces child protection services, nutrition programs, and gender equality initiatives through a network of state- and district-level agencies.

name: Bombay High Court
description: The Bombay High Court is one of the oldest High Courts in India, established on 14 August 1862. It has jurisdiction over the states of Maharashtra and Goa, and the Union Territories of Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu. The court hears civil, criminal, constitutional, and administrative cases, oversees subordinate courts, and serves as an important appellate and supervisory authority in its jurisdiction.
